title: Chelsea given update on N'Golo Kante's injury by France boss Didier Deschamps
text:

Didier Deschamps has moved to reassure Chelsea fans over N'Golo Kante's injury, saying the Chelsea midfielder was pulled out of the France line-up to face Iceland as a precaution.

Kante handed Chelsea boss Frank Lampard a fresh injury worry by limping off with a groin problem in the warm-up ahead of France's Euro 2020 qualifying win over Iceland on Friday night.

Lampard had been in dialogue with France boss Didier Deschamps over the selection of Kante for the world champions' squad, as he has suffered with fitness issues throughout the campaign thus far.

Kante has only featured in four of Chelsea's eight Premier League fixtures - scoring in the 2-1 loss to Liverpool last month and the 4-1 victory over Southampton last weekend.

And Deschamps played down the severity of the setback, which saw the midfielder replaced in the starting XI by Moussa Sissoko - although the France boss could not say whether Kante would be fit to face Turkey on Monday.

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

"He felt a pain in the adductor muscle" said the France boss after the match.

"He had a feeling where he did not feel comfortable to play.

"I made the decision [to pull him from the squad], because maybe it could get even worse. I knew Moussa would be ready."

Asked whether Kante would play against Turkey, Deschamps said: "I do not think it’s too serious for NG [Kante], but I do not have an answer tonight."

(Image: AFP via Getty Images)

Lampard had been in dialogue with France boss Didier Deschamps over the selection of Kante for the world champions' squad, which led to the former Leicester midfielder missing France's matches against Albania and Andorra in September's international break.

Deschamps - himself a former Chelsea player - spoke about his conversations with Lampard when he announced his squad earlier this month, and took a little dig at the former England midfielder over his team selection .

"Lampard had asked me not to pick Kante at the last break," he told a press conference.

"If that's still the way I'm going to call him later to tell him it would be nice if you play Olivier Giroud a little bit!"
description: Heach coach says midfielder was pulled from starting XI as a precaution, while Frank Lampard has told France camp about concerns over his fitness
